app.army module¶

class app.army.Army(strategy=<class 'app.random_strategy.RandomStrategy'>)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class Army.

In this class is implemented the attack logic.

add_group(group)[source]¶

Function that adds group to army.

At this moment there is only one available group type - Squad. :param group: At this moment it is Squad that should be added to army’s squads.

attack(enemy)[source]¶

Attack function

While there are squads in attacker’s and defender’s Army, the attacker should choose defender’s squad according to it’s strategy. Then attacker’s squad damages defender’s squad. If defender’s squad is alive after that, it strikes back. The function returns when there is only one army left. :param Army enemy: the defender’s Army. :return: The return value is used to show log on the screen. :rtype: str

get_alive_squads()[source]¶

Get the list of army’s alive squads.

Returns:alive squads.
Return type:list.
get_strategy()[source]¶
is_alive()[source]¶

Function that checks if Army is alive.

Returns:True if it’s alive, False otherwise.
take_damage(squad, dmg)[source]¶

Take damage function.

The damage should be taken by specific squad. :param Squad squad: the squad that is attacked. :param float dmg: the amount of damage that was dealt.

app.army_factory module¶

class app.army_factory.ArmyFactory[source]¶

Bases: object

Class that creates Army objects.

classmethod create(strategy)[source]¶

Create Army.

Creates Army object with specific strategy that is passed as parameter. :param strategy: the strategy that should use Army to choose squad to attack. :return: Army object.

app.battle_field module¶

class app.battle_field.Battlefield(num_armies)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class that implements armies’ battle logic.

start()[source]¶

The function that starts the war.

While there are more than two armies on battlefield, one army should attack the other. The armies’ selection is random. :return::return: The return value is used to show log on the screen. :rtype: str

WSGI application.

  • resp_start – executable object of response start

array of strings
app.main.battle(num_armies)[source]¶

Function that starts the war.

Parameters:num_armies (int) – the number of armies on the battlefield.

:return:The return value is used to show log on the screen. :rtype: str

app.main.open_f(file, mode='r', parameter='')[source]¶

Open file function.

Parameters:
  • file (str) – path to file or file name
  • mode (str) –
    ‘r’ Open text file for reading. The stream is positioned at the
    beginning of the file.
    ‘r+’ Open for reading and writing. The stream is positioned at the
    beginning of the file.
    `w’ Truncate file to zero length or create text file for writing.
    The stream is positioned at the beginning of the file.
    ‘w+’ Open for reading and writing. The file is created if it does not
    exist, otherwise it is truncated. The stream is positioned at the beginning of the file.
    ‘a’ Open for writing. The file is created if it does not exist. The
    stream is positioned at the end of the file. Subsequent writes to the file will always end up at the then current end of file, irrespective of any intervening fseek(3) or similar.
    ‘a+’ Open for reading and writing. The file is created if it does not
    exist. The stream is positioned at the end of the file. Subse- quent writes to the file will always end up at the then current end of file, irrespective of any intervening fseek(3) or similar.
  • parameter (str) – used if it is needed to change the text in file.
Returns:

file’s content.
Return type:

str.

The damage that is dealt to squad is spread evenly among it’s units

Return type:float.
take_damage(dmg)[source]¶

Reduces the health of vehicle and the healths of it’s operator’s.

Vehicle takes 60% of damage, one operator takes 20%, the other ones - 10%. :param float dmg: damage that shoul be taken be vehicle.
